data.title: Bands whose lead singer isn't its most famous member
data.meta_description: I was surfing through Quora and stumbled upon a pretty interesting topic; which bands have someone other than the lead vocalist as their biggest star?  The original source listed Van Halen and S
data.text:
Post by Deleted on

I was surfing through Quora and stumbled upon a pretty interesting topic; which bands have someone other than the lead vocalist as their biggest star?

The original source listed Van Halen and Santana as examples. For Van Halen, its namesake Eddie Van Helen is listed as a top 5 guitarist, while David Lee Roth was just, well, there despite being a good vocalist. For Santana, although literally nobody knows who was its lead singer was or is, everyone knows who Carlos Santana is.

Another good example is Blink-182. While the band has had three different vocalists, I've always saw drummer Travis Barker as its most famous member.

Are there any more examples of this?

Post by Deleted on

It's fairly subjective I guess - I think there's an argument that both David Lee Roth and Sammy Hagar are more recognizable than Eddie, which could be interpreted as being more famous. They both had successful solo careers which I think only strengthens this argument.

There's also Motley Crue - with Tommy potentially being more famous to some than Vince. But again, totally debatable.

Slash from Guns N Roses is a stretch, although he kept his name out there longer than Axl did, at least in terms of making music after their initial breakup. He also had some high profile features. But it's still hard to argue anyone being more famous than Axl, really.

Post by mkarns on

@mello said:

It's fairly subjective I guess - I think there's an argument that both David Lee Roth and Sammy Hagar are more recognizable than Eddie, which could be interpreted as being more famous. They both had successful solo careers which I think only strengthens this argument.

There's also Motley Crue - with Tommy potentially being more famous to some than Vince. But again, totally debatable.

Slash from Guns N Roses is a stretch, although he kept his name out there longer than Axl did, at least in terms of making music after their initial breakup. He also had some high profile features. But it's still hard to argue anyone being more famous than Axl, really.

Re Motley Crue, I always thought that Nikki Sixx was at least as well known or prominent as Vince Neil. Later on Tommy Lee as well, though not entirely for musical reasons.

The G'n'R analogy got me thinking of Nirvana. It's hard to think of many musicians being much more famous than Kurt Cobain, but Dave Grohl has of course gone onto great things since. I wonder if Dave is now almost as well known to those not old enough to remember Nirvana firsthand?

Post by Deleted on

@mello said:

It's fairly subjective I guess - I think there's an argument that both David Lee Roth and Sammy Hagar are more recognizable than Eddie, which could be interpreted as being more famous. They both had successful solo careers which I think only strengthens this argument.

There's also Motley Crue - with Tommy potentially being more famous to some than Vince. But again, totally debatable.

Slash from Guns N Roses is a stretch, although he kept his name out there longer than Axl did, at least in terms of making music after their initial breakup. He also had some high profile features. But it's still hard to argue anyone being more famous than Axl, really.

Re Motley Crue, I always thought that Nikki Sixx was at least as well known or prominent as Vince Neil. Later on Tommy Lee as well, though not entirely for musical reasons.

The G'n'R analogy got me thinking of Nirvana. It's hard to think of many musicians being much more famous than Kurt Cobain, but Dave Grohl has of course gone onto great things since. I wonder if Dave is now almost as well known to those not old enough to remember Nirvana firsthand?

Good point about Kurt/Dave. But, like Axl, Kurt is this iconic legend to so many, he's practically immortal. So Foo Fighters could have gone on to be the most successful band ever, and I still feel like Kurt would be more famous than Dave.

Then there's the difference between famous and infamous. Tommy Lee is probably good example of this. haha.

Post by Gekkouga on

Jane's Addiction - Dave Navarro (guitarist) is far more famous than Perry Farrell (lead vocalist)

I'd put him in the same bucket as Tommy Lee of people who are more famous but not because of the music. I dont think he would have been nearly as famous if not for his connection to Carmen Electra

Probably, but he also was known for his work with RHCP and other artists (Janet, Alanis, Xtina, etc) Sorta like Slash. Being famous for celebrity gossip/tabloids does not take away credit from them.
